thread.title: Castlefinn community group recognised for climate action initiatives
thread.title_full: Castlefinn community group recognised for climate action initiatives

author: Staff Writer
title: Castlefinn community group recognised for climate action initiatives
text:
CPI Castlefinn was this week recognised by Donegal County Council at the Donegal Community Climate Action Fund Showcase.
The presentation took place in the Regional Cultural Centre, Letterkenny, as part of Climate Action Week 2025.
The event highlighted inspiring local projects taking climate action across the county, with presentations on circular economy initiatives, community-led decarbonisation, and cross-border collaborations.
CPI Castlefinn featured as part of the Cross-Border Climate Action Projects case study, delivered by Cathy Burns of Derry City & Strabane District Council, showcasing how community partnerships are driving real impact on the ground.
Pictured at the event are (Lâ€“R): John G. McLaughlin, Chief Executive, Donegal County Council; Lorraine Arbuckle, Donegal County Council; Cathy Burns, Derry City & Strabane District Council; Cllr Donal Mandy Kelly, Leas-Cathaoirleach, Donegal County Council; Stephen Kennedy, CPI Manager; and Michael McGarvey, Donegal County Council.
